content.p: National Chemical Engineering Symposium (NACES) is an annual, national-level event organised by Chemical Engineering Student Society of Universities in Malaysia, in collaboration with Institution of Chemical Engineers (IChemE), Malaysia. NACES 2016 will be held at the University of Nottingham, Malaysia Campus (UNMC). This event will be organised by UNMC’s Instituition of Chemical Engineers (IChemE) Student Chapter, Department of Chemical and Environmental Engineering, UNMC and IChemE Malaysia. About NACES 2016 Date: 9- 11 of September 2016 Venue: The University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus Fees: RM 300 per participant With the theme ‘X-Solution: Food-Water-Energy Nexus’, NACES 2016 will incorporate seven major technical sessions: 1. Technical Essay Writing 2. Technical Case Study 3. Technical PowerPoint Presentation 4. Technical Debate Competition 5. Technical Video Presentation 6. Chemical Engineering Challenge 7. Process Plant Design. The symposium serves as a platform for young elites to show case their technical knowledge, creative thinking and effective communication skills in generating innovative solutions for global development issues and challenges aligning with the theme. Meanwhile, NACES 2016 promotes the significance of professional engineering practices and awareness in sustainable energy supplies, food and nutrition as well as access to clean water, three areas where chemical engineering can make a positive impact. Registration & Payment For registration and payment, please visit our Facebook. Enquiries For more information about NACES 2016, visit NACES 2016 on Facebook, or email to Naces2016@nottingham.edu.my. telephone: +6 (03) 8924 8000 fax: +6 (03) 8924 8001
